verses.text: They told David, 'Look, the Philistines are fighting against Keilah, and they are robbing the threshing floors.'
verses.comment: David is informed of the Philistine attack on Keilah, a town in Judah.

verses.text: So David asked the LORD, 'Shall I go and strike these Philistines?' And the LORD said to David, 'Go, and strike the Philistines and save Keilah.'
verses.comment: David inquires of the LORD, seeking guidance before acting.

verses.text: But David's men said to him, 'Look, we are afraid here in Judah. How much more, then, if we go to Keilah against the armies of the Philistines?'
verses.comment: David's men express fear at fighting the Philistines.

verses.text: Then David asked the LORD again. And the LORD answered him, 'Get up, go down to Keilah. For I will give the Philistines into your hand.'
verses.comment: God reassures David of victory when David seeks confirmation.

verses.text: So David and his men went to Keilah, fought with the Philistines, struck them with a great blow, and took away their livestock. So David saved the inhabitants of Keilah.
verses.comment: David wins the battle and rescues Keilah.

verses.text: When Abiathar the son of Ahimelech fled to David at Keilah, he came down with an ephod in his hand.
verses.comment: Abiathar brings the ephod, an object used for seeking God's will.

verses.text: Now it was told Saul that David had come to Keilah. And Saul said, 'God has given him into my hand, for he has shut himself in by entering a town with gates and bars.'
verses.comment: Saul wrongly assumes David is trapped in Keilah.

verses.text: And Saul summoned all the people to war, to go down to Keilah, to besiege David and his men.
verses.comment: Saul gathers forces to attack.

verses.text: When David knew that Saul was plotting evil against him, he said to Abiathar the priest, 'Bring the ephod here.'
verses.comment: David seeks God's direction using the ephod.

verses.text: Then David said, 'O LORD, God of Israel, your servant has surely heard that Saul seeks to come to Keilah, to destroy the city on my account.'
verses.comment: David prays for guidance in view of Saul's threat.

verses.text: 'Will the men of Keilah surrender me into his hand? Will Saul come down, as your servant has heard? O LORD, God of Israel, please tell your servant.' And the LORD said, 'He will come down.'
verses.comment: David receives confirmation that Saul will come.

verses.text: Then David said, 'Will the men of Keilah surrender me and my men into Saul’s hand?' And the LORD said, 'They will surrender you.'
verses.comment: God reveals the people of Keilah would betray David.

verses.text: Then David and his men, about six hundred, set out and departed from Keilah, and they went wherever they could go. And when Saul was told that David had escaped from Keilah, he gave up the pursuit.
verses.comment: David now has six hundred men.

verses.text: And David stayed in the wilderness strongholds and remained in the hill country of the Wilderness of Ziph. Saul looked for him every day, but God did not give him into his hand.
verses.comment: David's survival is credited to God's protection.

verses.text: When David saw that Saul had come out to seek his life, David was in the wilderness of Ziph at Horesh.
verses.comment: The narrative shifts to David's location in Horesh.

verses.text: And Jonathan, Saul's son, rose and went to David at Horesh and strengthened his hand in God.
verses.comment: 'Strengthened his hand in God' is a Hebrew idiom for encouragement in faith.

verses.text: And he said to him, 'Do not be afraid, for the hand of Saul my father will not find you. You shall be king over Israel, and I shall be next to you. My father Saul knows this too.'
verses.comment: Jonathan openly recognizes David's future kingship.

verses.text: And the two of them made a covenant before the LORD. Then David stayed at Horesh, and Jonathan went home.
verses.comment: Their covenant is renewed.

verses.text: Then the Ziphites went up to Saul at Gibeah, saying, 'Is not David hiding among us in the strongholds at Horesh, on the hill of Hachilah, which is south of Jeshimon?'
verses.comment: Ziphites offer to betray David's location.

verses.text: Now, O king, come down, according to all that your heart desires to do, and our part will be to surrender him into the king's hand.'
verses.comment: The Ziphites pledge to help Saul.

verses.text: And Saul said, 'May you be blessed by the LORD, for you have had compassion on me.'
verses.comment: Saul blesses the Ziphites for their information.

verses.text: Go now, make sure, and find out exactly where he is and who has seen him there, for it is told me that he is very cunning.
verses.comment: 'Cunning' means shrewd or skillful.

verses.text: See therefore, and take note of all the hiding places where he hides and come back to me with sure information. Then I will go with you. And if he is in the land, I will search him out among all the thousands of Judah.'
verses.comment: Saul demands precise information for his pursuit.

verses.text: So they arose and went to Ziph ahead of Saul. Now David and his men were in the wilderness of Maon, in the Arabah to the south of Jeshimon.
verses.comment: David has moved further south to Maon.

verses.text: And Saul and his men went to seek him. When David was told, he went down to the rock and lived in the wilderness of Maon. When Saul heard that, he pursued David into the wilderness of Maon.
verses.comment: 'The rock' possibly refers to a rocky region or outcrop.

verses.text: Saul went on one side of the mountain, and David and his men on the other side of the mountain. David was hurrying to get away from Saul. But as Saul and his men were closing in on David and his men to capture them,
verses.comment: A tense pursuit with David nearly trapped.

verses.text: A messenger came to Saul, saying, 'Hurry and come, for the Philistines have made a raid against the land.'
verses.comment: Saul is called away from capturing David.

verses.text: So Saul returned from pursuing David and went against the Philistines. Therefore that place was called the Rock of Escape.
verses.comment: 'Rock of Escape' in Hebrew is Sela-ha-Mahlekoth.

verses.text: And David went up from there and lived in the strongholds of Engedi.
verses.comment: David flees to Engedi, setting up the next episode.
